Your health information related to this study, may be used or disclosed in connection with this research study, including, but not limited to information pertaining to blood pressure management. This includes blood pressure readings, blood pressure medications and other information that your doctor will use to make blood pressure management decisions, which include kidney function lab tests, electrolyte lab tests, race/ethnicity, age, weight, and pregnancy information.

Welcome back!
Research Health Study Consent Form
Description

You are invited to participate in a research study on using a new technology to manage high blood pressure (hypertension) at home without requiring clinic visits, using a mobile application and a home blood pressure cuff. You will be asked to record your blood pressure at home twice a week, for a total of 12 weeks, using a blood pressure cuff that will be provided to you, which will then collect and send readings to your doctor. Your doctor may then modify your blood pressure medications, including changing doses or adding new medications, based on your blood pressure readings. You will also be asked to fill out surveys on this technology, which will be de-identified and used for research purposes to improve the technology.

You are invited to participate in a research study on using a new technology to manage high blood pressure (hypertension) at home without requiring clinic visits, using a mobile application and a home blood pressure cuff. You will be asked to record your blood pressure at home twice a week, for a total of 12 weeks, using a blood pressure cuff that will be provided to you, which will then collect and send readings to your doctor. Your doctor may then modify your blood pressure medications, including changing doses or adding new medications, based on your blood pressure readings. You will also be asked to fill out surveys on this technology, which will be de-identified and used for research purposes to improve the technology.
Data Gathering

The purpose of the research study is to evaluate the feasibility of a mobile technology to manage blood pressure (hypertension) at home without requiring you to come into a doctor’s office. This involves using a home blood pressure cuff, direct transmission of readings to your doctor. Your health information will be used only in the context of your doctor changing your blood pressure medications based on your home blood pressure readings. You will also fill out surveys on the technology which will not contain your health information and will be de-identified and used to improve the technology.

The purpose of the research study is to evaluate the feasibility of a mobile technology to manage blood pressure (hypertension) at home without requiring you to come into a doctor’s office. This involves using a home blood pressure cuff, direct transmission of readings to your doctor. Your health information will be used only in the context of your doctor changing your blood pressure medications based on your home blood pressure readings. You will also fill out surveys on the technology which will not contain your health information and will be de-identified and used to improve the technology.
Privacy

The following parties are authorized to use and/or disclose your health information in connection with this research study: The Protocol Director (Dr. Paul Wang) The Stanford University Administrative Panel on Human Subjects in Medical Research and any other unit of Stanford University as necessary Research Staff

The following parties are authorized to use and/or disclose your health information in connection with this research study: The Protocol Director (Dr. Paul Wang) The Stanford University Administrative Panel on Human Subjects in Medical Research and any other unit of Stanford University as necessary Research Staff
Data Use

Your health information related to this study, may be used or disclosed in connection with this research study, including, but not limited to information pertaining to blood pressure management. This includes blood pressure readings, blood pressure medications and other information that your doctor will use to make blood pressure management decisions, which include kidney function lab tests, electrolyte lab tests, race/ethnicity, age, weight, and pregnancy information.

Your health information related to this study, may be used or disclosed in connection with this research study, including, but not limited to information pertaining to blood pressure management. This includes blood pressure readings, blood pressure medications and other information that your doctor will use to make blood pressure management decisions, which include kidney function lab tests, electrolyte lab tests, race/ethnicity, age, weight, and pregnancy information.
Time Commitment
Your participation in this experiment will take approximately 3 months.
Your participation in this experiment will take approximately 3 months.
Study Survey

To maintain the integrity of this research study, you may not have access to any health information developed as part of this study until it is completed. At that point, you would have access to such health information if it was used to make a medical or billing decision about you (e.g., if included in your official medical record).

To maintain the integrity of this research study, you may not have access to any health information developed as part of this study until it is completed. At that point, you would have access to such health information if it was used to make a medical or billing decision about you (e.g., if included in your official medical record).
Study Tasks
Information about any task(s) in the app.
Information about any task(s) in the app. Additional content.
Withdrawing

The Protocol Director may also withdraw you from the study without your consent for one or more of the following reasons o Failure to follow the instructions of the Protocol Director and study staff. o The Protocol Director decides that continuing your participation could be harmful to you. o Pregnancy o You need treatment not allowed in the study. o The study is cancelled. o Other administrative reasons. o Unanticipated circumstances.

The Protocol Director may also withdraw you from the study without your consent for one or more of the following reasons o Failure to follow the instructions of the Protocol Director and study staff. o The Protocol Director decides that continuing your participation could be harmful to you. o Pregnancy o You need treatment not allowed in the study. o The study is cancelled. o Other administrative reasons. o Unanticipated circumstances.
